name: Michael Howell From Capital Wars
title: The Debtliquidity Spiral
text:
Synopsis
The global financial system is increasingly driven by debt refinancing cycles, with the financial sector now dominating the economy through complex liquidity and debt mechanisms that fundamentally shape economic dynamics.

Key Insights
- The financial sector has surpassed traditional industry as the primary economic driver
- Capital markets now function primarily as debt refinancing mechanisms rather than new capital raising platforms
- Economic cycles are increasingly determined by 5-6 year debt refinancing cycles, not traditional interest rate mechanisms
- Wealth effects from asset markets have become crucial determinants of economic spending
- Government debt interest payments now represent a key income source for the private sector
- The balance sheet capacity of the financial sector (liquidity) is now more important than interest rates in economic cycle determination
